items.title: OpenCRISPR-1: AI-Designed Programmable Gene Editor Achieves Precision Human Genome Editing

content.abstract: Large language models trained on biological sequences designed OpenCRISPR-1, a programmable gene editor demonstrating precision editing of the human genome. Released for ethical research and commercial use. Compatible with base editing systems.

items.title: Quantum Machine Learning Tutorial: Practical Guide for ML Practitioners

content.abstract: Comprehensive hands-on tutorial introducing quantum machine learning (QML) for classical ML practitioners. Covers variational quantum circuits, quantum kernel methods, and practical implementation on current NISQ hardware.

items.title: TraceCoder: Trace-Driven Multi-Agent Framework for Automated LLM Code Debugging

content.abstract: Multi-agent framework using execution traces to automatically debug LLM-generated code. Achieves 87% fix rate on benchmarks, outperforming single-agent approaches by 23%.

items.title: LLM Rational Agency: Measuring Belief Coherence in Probabilistic Decision Making

content.abstract: Novel framework for evaluating whether LLMs act as rational agents by measuring belief coherence across probabilistic decisions. Finds GPT-5 and Claude exhibit partial coherence but systematic biases in risk assessment.

items.title: Climate-Biodiversity Destabilizing Feedback Loop: Quantitative Evidence from 2015-2025 Data

content.abstract: Quantitative analysis of 2015-2025 data confirms a destabilizing feedback loop between climate change and biodiversity loss. Ecosystem service degradation accelerates carbon release, creating a reinforcing cycle projected to amplify warming by 0.3-0.5C by 2050.

items.title: Groundwater Depletion Acceleration Under Climate Change: Global Assessment of Agricultural and Urban Risks

content.abstract: Global assessment reveals climate change is accelerating groundwater depletion 2-3x faster than previous models predicted. 1.8 billion people in agricultural regions and 500+ cities face critical water stress by 2035.

items.title: First-Order Temporal Logic Reward Specification in Reinforcement Learning (AAAI 2026)

content.abstract: Accepted at AAAI 2026. Introduces first-order temporal logic for specifying reward functions in RL, enabling more precise and interpretable reward shaping for complex robotic tasks. Demonstrates 40% improvement in sample efficiency.

items.title: CRISPR-Cas9 for Alzheimer's and Parkinson's: Next-Generation Precision Treatment Approaches

content.abstract: Comprehensive review of CRISPR-Cas9 applications in neurodegenerative diseases. Identifies 12 gene targets for Alzheimer's and 8 for Parkinson's. Discusses blood-brain barrier delivery challenges and proposes nanoparticle-based solutions achieving 60% transfection efficiency.

items.title: AI Agents for Clinical Workflows: Architecture, MLOps, and Governance Framework

content.abstract: Engineering framework for deploying AI agents in clinical healthcare settings. Covers modular architecture, MLOps pipelines, regulatory compliance (FDA 510(k)/De Novo), and clinical governance. Tested across 3 hospital systems with 94% clinician acceptance.

items.title: Quantum Deep Learning Still Needs a Quantum Leap: Empirical Analysis of Current Limitations

content.abstract: Empirical study demonstrating that quantum computing hardware is substantially slower than classical hardware for deep learning tasks, resulting in theoretical runtime advantages being lost. Identifies barren plateau problem and decoherence as primary bottlenecks.

items.title: Carbon Credit Market Integrity: Machine Learning Detection of Low-Quality Offsets

content.abstract: ML model achieving 92% accuracy in identifying low-quality carbon offsets. Analysis of 15,000+ projects reveals 30-40% of voluntary market credits may overestimate emissions reductions. Proposes integrity scoring framework.

items.title: Income and Labour Productivity Losses from Climate Change: Updated Global Projections to 2100

content.abstract: Updated global projections show climate-driven income losses of 12-23% by 2100 under current trajectory. Labour productivity losses concentrated in tropical regions, with agricultural workers losing 15-30% of effective working hours by 2050.

items.title: Quantum Approximate Optimization Algorithm Applied to Integer Optimization on Graphs

content.abstract: Novel QAOA application to integer optimization problems on graphs, achieving near-optimal solutions for graphs up to 40 nodes. Demonstrates practical quantum advantage threshold may be reached with 100-200 logical qubits.

items.title: AI-Revolutionized CRISPR Guide RNA Design: Enhancing Off-Target Prediction and Editing Efficiency

content.abstract: AI models leveraging large datasets from diverse CRISPR experiments achieve 95% accuracy in guide RNA design and 89% accuracy in off-target prediction. Reduces experimental design time from weeks to hours.

items.title: Global Dengue Incidence Projections Under Climate Change: 2025-2050 Risk Assessment

content.abstract: Climate-driven expansion of Aedes mosquito range projects dengue incidence to double by 2040. Southern Europe, southern US, and East Asia identified as emerging high-risk zones. Current vaccine coverage insufficient for projected burden.
